intro: Siparuna tenuipes, commonly known as the slender-leaved siparuna, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Siparuna tenuipes is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
